Posts.Content: Question, for many years going into surgery two years ago I had been on Wellbutrin with good results. Since the surgery I feel more depressed and have tried to work through it. Gotten worse lately and part of it is frustration of the little man not wanting to get completely warmed up. Gotten to the point where I am snapping at folks and letting a lot of things worry me. I am going to see my PCP on the 19th. Anyone else had these problems.

Posts.Title: Urine during stimulation

Posts.Content: Thanks...DR didnt give me the Gleason. We meet with him tomorrow to cover everything. Just kinda worried at this point
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: Thanks...DR didnt give me the Gleason. We meet with him tomorrow to cover everything. Just kinda worried at this point
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: May have asked this before but couldnt find it so I will ask again. I am weeks from DaVinci surgery. Great news is that first PSA was all zeros but still have pretty bad leaking and when my wife and I have tried to practice stimulation I start peeing and get no erection. I am taking Cialis daily. Any thoughts? Just frustrated
Posts.Title: Urine during stimulation

Posts.Content: Just found out Friday. DR said it was not in all of the 12 samples and non aggressive type. PSA 5.8. 56 years old. What can I expect
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: Just found out Friday. DR said it was not in all of the 12 samples and non aggressive type. PSA 5.8. 56 years old. What can I expect
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: OK...here we go. Gleason was 3+3=6 in 4 samples and 3+4=7 in the other. So five of 12 positive. Dr gave me all of the options and to be honest I am leaning toward surgery and get it resolved.
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: OK...here we go. Gleason was 3+3=6 in 4 samples and 3+4=7 in the other. So five of 12 positive. Dr gave me all of the options and to be honest I am leaning toward surgery and get it resolved.
Posts.Title: Just found out

Posts.Content: Ok guys, been right at 18 months since Robotic surgery. Thank goodness they got it all and no treatments. The little man is trying to play especially with Viagra BUT it seems like everytime wife and I start the process that I leak urine. This morning I had forgotten a towel and it got bad and I just lost it. I screamed at her because she noticed it first. I know its not her fault but I am at my wits end. I see the Dr on the 29th and trust me we are going to have a long talk.

Posts.Title: Frustration

Posts.Content: Thanks guys. I did apologize to her. I have tried the emptying the bladder and the rings with some but not a lot of success. I told him about it a while back and he said that it was something that was going to take time. I see him on 6/29 and will have a long visit with him again about this situation. I have had bladder issues all my life, go a lot, so that may be it.

Posts.Title: Two year anniversary

Posts.Content: I tell you, this is tough to deal with. I do the exercises. I take med's, I dont take med's. I move a bit in any direction and the river flows. It is so frustrating. I call the DR and talk to the nurse and she says well first thing to remember is that everyone recovers different. Remember that you are not 40 but over 50. You have to be patient. It will be 12 weeks this Wednesday and it is getting tough to deal with. Thanks for the vent
Posts.Title: Getting tough to deal with

Posts.Content: I tell you, this is tough to deal with. I do the exercises. I take med's, I dont take med's. I move a bit in any direction and the river flows. It is so frustrating. I call the DR and talk to the nurse and she says well first thing to remember is that everyone recovers different. Remember that you are not 40 but over 50. You have to be patient. It will be 12 weeks this Wednesday and it is getting tough to deal with. Thanks for the vent
Posts.Title: Getting tough to deal with

Posts.Content: Congrats!!! I just got all zero's after 7 weeks!!!

Posts.Content: Congrats!!! I just got all zero's after 7 weeks!!!
Posts.Title: One year out: still good

Posts.Content: Welcome to the club!!!
Posts.Title: Not sure where I landed post op PSA .06

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Badman Am 7 weeks post op and am doing better. I spurt every time I move quickly or strain in any way. Also when sneezing or at work, as I am always up and down at work. So is the spurting versus the constant dribble I had a sign of my Kegels working? I do them twice a day and also at night the flow is greatly reduced. Just wondering if anyone has this experience also and is it a good sign? This almost me to a tee. Same time period and everything. Sometimes its when I get up out of the chair.
Posts.Title: Incontinence Update

Posts.Content: Welcome to the club!!!
Posts.Title: Not sure where I landed post op PSA .06

Posts.Content: I finally had my surgery Wednesday with the DaVinci system. Was a long surgery about 7 hours not including recovery time. Spent one night in hospital and am at home. Pain is really not bad. I have taken pain meds at bedtime but other than that not even Tylenol. Big issue is the Catheter. How long have most of you had to wear this awful thing?
Posts.Title: Catheter after DaVinci

Posts.Content: I finally had my surgery Wednesday with the DaVinci system. Was a long surgery about 7 hours not including recovery time. Spent one night in hospital and am at home. Posts.Title: Catheter after DaVinci

Posts.Content: Its has been tested 4 times and all of them the same, all of them less than .001 so there is nothing there. I had a reaction to generic Paxil years ago so I try to really watch for anything like that. I think it may just be everything that I have had going on that could be causing it. I get labs again next month so I will ask the Dr if they need to check everything

Posts.Title: Hormones and moods

Posts.Content: Ok guys, serious question here. Had Robot surgery 16 months ago. PSA has been normal ever since. Recently I have gotten more and more moody. Granted the little lady hasnt been cooperating too much lately but the little man works with Viagra and a ring. I also had neck surgery around New Years but it went great. I take 300mg Wellbutrin daily. Could my hormones be out of wack and causing this? Thanks for the ops.

Posts.Title: Hormones and moods

Posts.Content: My ED is better as long as I take Viagra and have some action within the 1-3 hour period. Bothers me to have to ask is there going be any action tonight so I can take the pills. I am having my 18 month checkup on the 29th and going to get labs drawn Friday so I can have them when I go to surgeon. I was going to ask them to test my testosterone levels this time. Everytime I get them to test that, my Dr always laughs because one time her nurse checked that I was a female and everything showed I was a true stud. When the nurse called me and told me the results and said Dude you should be a stud, being the cute guy I am, I asked did she want to find out. When they had to redraw it the next week she got her revenge with the needle.

Posts.Title: Hormones and moods

Posts.Content: Have any of you take this drug? Dr prescribed this for me because of the leaks and surges but this stuff knocked me for a loop and I called the Dr and told them and they had me get off for three days starting yesterday. Any thoughts? PSA of 0.00 on 3/11/16!!!
Posts.Title: Imipramine Hydrochloride

Posts.Content: As most have read, I had DaVinci on 1/20//16. Had some issues with UTI'S, including one a week ago, but that has cleared up and I am down to one pad a day. The frustrated part is that at time, I feel like a sexual cripple. I have tried Cialis and Viagra and they dont help but part of the problem there is that anytime, I try to self-stimulate or my wife tries to, I had leak badly. All I hear from the DR is that it just takes time. It got so bad yesterday when we tried, after completely voiding, I leaked real bad, she said she wanted to stop and I got up and left the house for while so I could go scream and cry for a few minutes. At times I just want to beat my head against the wall. Any thoughts guys?

Posts.Title: Seriously Frustrated

Posts.Content: I went to my Primary care Dr this week for the "normal" lab work and they did the usual stuff and ordered a PSA as they have done for years and low and behold I got it back and it said less than 0.001 so I am very happy with that
Posts.Title: Well got some good news yesterday

Posts.Content: Had my first post-op PSA on the 3rd and got the results late last week and I am proud member of the zero club!!! 7 weeks from surgery
Posts.Title: First Post-op PSA

Posts.Content: Well most it behind a desk but we are subject to have to go in the field, transport prisoners, maybe have to use physical force at time. ALso I have to drive 40 miles each way to work
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: Thanks...I have bunchs, 23 weeks, of leave time on the books so I should be good
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: Thanks...I tell my young ones the same thing but they dont want to listen

Posts.Content: Thanks...I tell my young ones the same thing but they dont want to listen
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: Thanks...I have bunchs, 23 weeks, of leave time on the books so I should be good
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: After the Dr finally got me on Ditropan XL there has been a remarkable difference with the wetness problem. After 4 days I was able to go to the pads during the day and usually only one pad. This week it has been one pad a day. Last night I took the big step of sleeping without the Depends for the first time and it was fine.
Posts.Title: Big Improvement!!!

Posts.Content: Had my first post-op PSA on the 3rd and got the results late last week and I am proud member of the zero club!!! 7 weeks from surgery
Posts.Title: First Post-op PSA

Posts.Content: Well most it behind a desk but we are subject to have to go in the field, transport prisoners, maybe have to use physical force at time. ALso I have to drive 40 miles each way to work
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: I am having DaVinci surgery on 1/20. Dr first said two weeks off but I told him that I worked in Law Enforcement so he said maybe 4-6 weeks. Does this sound right? Thanks
Posts.Title: When to go back to work

Posts.Content: Well I had it first week while the cath was in and it was pure hell. After a round of antibiotics it cleared up and then came back two weeks later so another round. I feel for you
Posts.Title: Interstitial Cystitis/Painful Bladder Syndrome after catheter?

Posts.Content: Thanks!!! I needed this kind of thing to happen
Posts.Signature: ------------------------------------------------------------------- First PSA in July 2014-5.0 2nd PSA in August 2015-5.8 Biopsy 11/19/15 DaVinci surgery 1/20/16 ------------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------------------------------------- DIAGNOSIS: Radical prostatectomy specimen (40 grams): 1. Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, Gleason''s 3 + 4 = 7 ( see synoptic report.). 2. Tumor involves the bladder neck margin, right posterior, mid a nd anterior prostate as well as the left posterior and mid prostate. COMMENTS: TUMOR SYNOPTIC REPORT Specimen Procedure: Radical prostatectomy Prostate Size: 6.2 x 4.4 x 4 cm Weight: 40 g Lymph Node Sampling: No lymph nodes present Tumor Histologic Type: Adenocarcinoma Histologic Grade: Gleason Pattern Primary Pattern: Grade 3 Secondary Pattern: Grade 4 Tertiary Pattern: Not applicable Total Gleason Score: 7
Posts.Title: Big Improvement!!!

Posts.Content: Just had my three followup. PSA undetectable and Dr said "I consider your cancer gone."!!!!

Posts.Title: Three year checkup

Posts.Content: Just a curious question.....Does your insurance pay for the pump? I am to the point of trying one and a good one if insurance will pay.
